result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 146.  8:33 AM Court calls cases - recites appearances.  State recites plea - G/NC to count 1 and count 2 in 14 CF 161 the repeater status to be dropped and all other charges dismissed and used as read-in also 14 CF 146 dismiss read-in and will request probation.  Atty McL agrees.  Atty Nerbun agrees.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Court grants motion to delete repeater.
Atty McL  entered plea of nc to counts 1 and 2 in 14 CF 161.   Court finds defendant guilty counts 1 and 2 in 14 CF 161 repeater is deleted - other counts are dismissed and used as read-ins also 14 CF 146 is dismissed and used as read-in.  
State addressed his prior record at courts request
Atty McL makes arguement waived PSI - Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years concurrent each count  90 days as to count day with credit 72 days time served with huber - costs both counts - AODA and any follow thru- any other counselling as directed by DOC to report to doc within 72 hours of release
Status conference on April 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney James C. McLaughlin in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 14CF146 that Judge Anderson will also have.  Atty McL asks for a motion hearing.  Motion hearing and status conference for 4/8/15 @ 9:30am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Waived Reading-Not guilty plea is entered.  Def. McL is asking for a substitution in this case as well as his other felony case.  Request is accepted. Clerk to enter substition.

Defendant, Jeffrey J. Nerbun appeared with Attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Attorney Angeline E. Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. State calls Officer Trevor Peterson to the stand.  State speaks to the court.  State questions Officer Peterson.  Court finds that the Officer has identifed the defendant.  No futher questions from the State.  Cross by Atty McL. No further questions from Atty McL. Recross from the state.  Nothing futher. Recross from the McL. Witness is excused. 
Court finds that there is probable cause and that the defendant committed a felony in Washburn County and is bound over for trial.
Preliminary hearing on December 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Atty McL is requesting a bail modification to signature bond with a small cash bond.  Atty Winton argues requests the court deny modification of bond.  Court: bail modification is denied.  Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in custody.  Atty Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  and INIT in 14 CF 161 - Atty McL waived reading as to this file NG as to the misd. requests right for substitution at a later time.  Prelim in 14 CF 146 - Trevor Peterson called - state requests judicial notice be taken to several JOC's attached.  Court will take judicial notice.  State examines witness.  Cross- examined Atty McLaughlin.  State arguement.  Atty McL makes arguement.

Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Atty McL does not waive time limits as defendant is on a cash bail
Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed Doctor.
